job_title: Software Engineer Intern - Applied Machine Learning
description: Descriptif du posteWho we areHelsing is a defence AI company. Our mission is to protect our democracies. We aim to achieve technological leadership, so that open societies can continue to make sovereign decisions and control their ethical standards.Â As democracies, we believe we have a special responsibility to be thoughtful about the development and deployment of powerful technologies like AI. We take this responsibility seriously.Â We are an ambitious and committed team of engineers, AI specialists and customer-facing programme managers.Â We are looking for mission-driven people to join our European teams â€“ and apply their skills to solve the most complex and impactful problems. We embrace an open and transparent culture that welcomes healthy debates on the use of technology in defence, its benefits, and its ethical implications.Â Â The RoleAs a working student in STEM, you will push the implementation of state-of-the-art algorithms into real-world applications and test your solutions in the lab and the fieldÂ You will work with drones and advance their capabilities through software and AIBe part of a highly talented, boundary-pushing team and work with globally renowned AI expertsYou will work closely with a team based in Munich, but interact with a broader team all over EuropeThe day-to-dayConceptualise application of state-of-the-art technologies and discuss them with the teamUnderstand advantages and disadvantages of different algorithmic approaches for our productDerive requirements regarding software architectures and implement selected software designsSummarise findings in clearly understandable documentsContribute towards the implementation of the most promising conceptsÂ The technologies we useWe rely on Rust and Python for most of our development, but if you're proficient in writing clean, high-quality code in other languages, we'll help you master our technology stack.Â Our cloud infrastructure is managed through Terraform, with Grafana and Prometheus for monitoring and visualisation.We use Nix to streamline development, ensuring that every engineer works with reliable, reproducible environments.We ensure an efficient and scalable communication between our services by utilising technologies like REST, GraphQL, gRPC/protobuf.Â You should apply if youYou are someone who enjoys taking initiative and working in a collaborative environment.Currently pursuing a PhD or MSc in STEMProgramming experience in Rust, Python, C++ or similar languages.Experience with software and infrastructure frameworks like Git and UnixAbility to communicate ideas clearly and work reliably and independentlyNote: We operate at an intersection where women, as well as other minority groups, are systemically under-represented. We encourage you to apply even if you donâ€™t meet all the listed qualifications; ability and impact cannot be summarised in a few bullet points.Â Nice to haveExperience in working in a collaborative and fast-paced environmentExperience in applying AI/ML algorithmsExperience with Nix build systemHands-on experience with flying and working on dronesÂ Join Helsing and work with world-leading experts in their fieldsÂ Helsingâ€™s work is important. Youâ€™ll be directly contributing to the protection of democratic countries while balancing both ethical and geopolitical concerns.Â The work is unique. We operate in a domain that has highly unusual technical requirements and constraints, and where robustness, safety, and ethical considerations are vital. You will face unique Engineering and AI challenges that make a meaningful impact in the world.Â Our work frequently takes us right up to the state of the art in technical innovation, be it reinforcement learning, distributed systems, generative AI, or deployment infrastructure. The defence industry is entering the most exciting phase of the technological development curve. Advances in our field of world are not incremental: Helsing is part of, and often leading, historic leaps forward.Â In our domain, success is a matter of order-of-magnitude improvements and novel capabilities. This means we take bets, aim high, and focus on big opportunities. Despite being a relatively young company, Helsing has already been selected for multiple significant government contracts.Â Â We actively encourage healthy, proactive, and diverse debate internally about what we do and how we choose to do it. Teams and individual engineers are trusted (and encouraged) to practise responsible autonomy and critical thinking, and to focus on outcomes, not conformity. At Helsing you will have a say in how we (and you!) work, the opportunity to engage on what does and doesnâ€™t work, and to take ownership of aspects of our culture that you care deeply about.Â Â What we offerFlexible hybrid working hours as well as regular feedback.An ambitious team located in the heart of London (as well as Berlin, Munich and Paris).Competitive compensation.The chance to join other mission-driven people in a fast-growing company focused on protecting our democracies.Opportunities to connect and network via diverse team events & fun outside the office.A social allowance and subsidised fitness membership to support your well-being.Â

This means we take bets, aim high, and focus on big opportunities. Despite being a relatively young company, Helsing has already been selected for multiple significant government contracts.Â Â We actively encourage healthy, proactive, and diverse debate internally about what we do and how we choose to do it. job_title: Research Engineer/Postdoc - Bioinformatics and Data Analysis (M/F)
description: Descriptif du posteContext: We are currently seeking a talented and motivated Bioinformatician for an exciting project funded by the European Horizon Europe aimed at advancing therapies for renal ciliopathies (https://theracil.eu). The candidate will join the lab of Dr. S. Saunier (Laboratory of Hereditary Kidney Diseases), a leader in functional studies on renal ciliopathies and the Bioinformatics platform at IMAGINE (led by P. NitschkÃ©).Background: Ciliopathies, a group of rare genetic diseases, result from primary cilium dysfunction and manifest in various severe disorders. These disorders, which include polycystic kidney diseases (ARPKD and ADPKD) and nephronophthisis, often lead to the progressive deterioration of renal function, resulting in late-stage renal disease. The projectâ€™s laboratory aims to enhance the diagnosis and prognosis of renal ciliopathy patients while implementing therapeutic approaches. The project involves a consortium of European partners leveraging unique databases and multi-omics data for patient stratification and identification of therapeutic targets.Â Mission Objectives: The recruited professional will analyze and integrate "omics" data, including WGS, RNA-Seq, and proteomics from patient cells, kidney organoids, and mouse models. Key tasks include analyzing scRNASeq and snRNASeq data to assess the impact of therapeutic interventions, identify target cell populations, and evaluate single-cell responses and immune cell involvement. The candidate will work closely with biologists and other bioinformaticians involved in the consortium.

Our AI is able to detect and classify damage on any vehicle, with photos taken by a smartphone. description: Descriptif du posteAt Neoplants, R&D team is constantly interested in developing new techniques & technologies.As AI intern for plants genetics at Neoplants, you will work on the development of an AI model to predict the best genetic scaffold for a given metabolic pathway in Nicotiana benthamiana.Context:The optimum expression of a complex metabolic pathway in a plant is currently a challenge as it is influenced by numerous factors such as the genes sequences, mRNA stability, codon bias, protein folding, stability and post translational modification. But the first elements that come into play are the genetic regulatory elements, such as promoters and terminators. For the model plant Nicotiana benthamiana there are an extensive number of publications describing the relative efficiencies of such regulatory elements. However these elements are always tested in a specific context which can affect the results and always in low complexity context (1 or 2 genes).At Neoplants, we design complex metabolic pathways with more than ten genes to improve plants. We then move these pathways into plants that scientists know little about, adding more complexity. To make the pathway work well, we have to try many different regulatory elements and figure out the right combination through trial and error. If we donâ€™t get it right, even one poorly expressed gene can reduce how well the entire pathway works.This is where an AI model could drastically increase the speed of iteration of our products.Objective:To overcome this limited amount of information our strategy is to develop an AI model that would be able to predict the set of genetic regulatory elements to use to reach the desired expression of complex metabolic pathways.Identify the best available foundation models to useFind and/or develop the right embedding for our purposeTraining and fine tuning of the model to predict a gene expression level based on a set of genetic regulatory elements.Increase the complexity of the genetic scaffold to more and more complex scaffold (from one gene to N genes)Ultimately train on various plant species in order to be able to predict the best scaffold not only in N. benthamiana but in any given plant.Fetch experimental data and genetic elements metadata from our LIMS (Laboratory Information and Management System), Benchling.You will also get the chance to discover the working environment of an R&D lab in a dynamic and vibrant startup.Project Title: AI model to predict the best genetic scaffoldProject Leader: JÃ©rÃ´me Bodin

job_title: Quantum-Enhanced Neural Networks for Drug Discovery Internship
description: Descriptif du posteAbout PasqalPASQAL designs and develops Quantum Processing Units (QPUs) and associated software tools.Our innovative technology enables us to address use cases that are currently beyond the reach of the most powerful supercomputers; these cases can concern industrial application challenges as well as fundamental science needs.In addition to the exceptional computing power they provide, QPUs are highly energy efficient and will contribute to a significant reduction in the carbon footprint of the HPC industry.Â Â Job DescriptionWe are a cutting-edge research team dedicated to advancing quantum computing and graph machine learning (ML) methods. Our focus is on leveraging neutral atom quantum computers to solve complex problems in graph ML tasks. One of the most prominent technologies is based on Rydberg neutral atoms, where an analog approach can be applied: as opposed to the case of digital quantum computing, the quantum operations are not divided into discrete consecutive steps (gates) but are rather the result of a time-dependent control of the Hamiltonian acting upon the qubits. Classical data such as graphs can be naturally encoded in such quantum processors by trapping atoms with lasers in the form of a graph. The force of their interactions defines the presence or absence of an edge on an effective graph. With this approach, we have shown in [1] that quantum graph kernels can distinguish non-isomorphic graphs where many other classical graph kernels fail. Recently, we also demonstrated in [2] that quantum features can serve as positional encodings for graphs and probably enhance the performance of classical graph transformers.   We are looking for an intern toÂ work on deep learning models applied to chemistry / drug discovery, exploring the potential of using neutral atom computers for machine learning powered drug discovery tasks (for instance, molecular dynamics, synthesis prediction, generative models, molecular docking, etc.). This project involves training a machine learning model enhanced by quantum features provided by a quantum computer (see [3]). The accepted candidate will collaborate with experts in quantum computing, quantum physics and graph and Quantum ML. The project goal is to extend the applicability of quantum-enhanced graph ML models to chemistry with potential provable benefits of the quantum approach. The accepted candidate will collaborate with experts in quantum computing, graph machine learning teams. The intern will learn to efficiently train ML models and understand the intricacies of quantum computing with neutral atom devices.Â [1] Henry, Louis-Paul, et al. "Quantum evolution kernel: Machine learning on graphs with programmable arrays of qubits." Physical Review A 104.3 (2021): 032416. [2] Thabet, Slimane, et al. "Quantum Positional Encodings for Graph Neural Networks." arXiv preprint arXiv:2406.06547 (2024). [3] D'Arcangelo, M., Henry, L. P., Henriet, L., Loco, D., Gouraud, N., Angebault, S., ... & Piquemal, J. P. (2024). Leveraging analog quantum computing with neutral atoms for solvent configuration prediction in drug discovery. Physical Review Research, 6(4), 043020. About youYou areÂ actively enrolled in a PhD program in a related program (i.e quantum physics, quantum computing, machine learning), and have the following assets:Â Hard skills:Â Experience with programming in PythonStrong interest in quantum computing, graph theory, and cutting-edge technologiesMachine Learning models in frameworks such as PyTorch, JAX and gExperience with chemical informatics packages, e.g. RDKit and good knowledge in chemistry / material design / drug discoveryExperience with at least one of the following: (quantum) machine learning or chemical or physics simulation or analog/digital quantum computing. Strong taste for Quantum Computing and a keen interest in deep tech and new technologies Excellent algorithm development, coding practices and numerical simulationsStrong documentation and report writing skillsFluency in English (oral and written)Preferred: Experience with at least one of the following: (Quantum) Machine Learning, computational chemistry (DFT, molecular dynamics, etc.) Experience simulating simple Quantum Spin Models  Bonus:Previous research experience â€“ Masters   thesis, previous Internship or similarExperience using quantum hardwareSoft skills:Â Clear and simple verbal and scientific communicationÂ AutonomyÂ ProactiveTeam player What we offerOffices in Amsterdam, The NetherlandsType of contract: 6-months internshipStart date: January 2025A dynamic and close-knit international teamA key role in a growing start-upRecruitment processAn interview with our Talent Acquisition Specialist (~30 mins)A coding test to prepare at home (optional)An technical interview with the Hiring Manager (~45 mins)An offer!PASQAL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, as inclusion and diversity are essential to achieving our mission. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, religion or sexual orientation.

job_title: Internship - Applications of AI in histopathology for PD-L1 classification
description: Descriptif du posteContexteAccurate cancer diagnosis often relies on histological examinations, where tissue samples are analyzed to confirm the presence of tumors and characterize lesions [1]. At Primaa, we develop deep learning methods to classify lesions, detect biomarkers, and segment regions of interest in tissue samples.This internship focuses on applied research for PD-L1 classification in kidney cancer. PD-L1 is a protein often expressed in cancer cells that can inhibit the immune response. Measuring PD-L1 levels, typically assessed using immunohistochemistry (IHC) (Figure 1), helps guide immunotherapy treatments, making accurate classification essential for effective patient care. In addition to IHC data, hematoxylin and eosin (HE) stained slides are also available for each case, providing a complementary view of the tissue structure.Figure 1. Representative IHC images of different PD-L1 expressions, from low (A) to high expression (D).[1]https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/FR/fr/applications/clinical-testing-and-diagnostics-manufacturing/histology?srsltid=AfmBOopIdAvPC9UvUjinhpvSgJl2Lq3hnEwdVN41aH-m6eXMbPmhmsvV#staining-in-histopathology[2] *Weakly supervised multiple instance learning histopathological tumor segmentation, M.Lerousseau, M.Vakalopoulou, M.Classe, J.Adam, E.Battistella, A.CarrÃ©, T.Estienne, T.Henry, E.eutsch and N.Paragios*[3] Bootstrapping Semantic Segmentation with Regional Contrast, S.Liu, S.Zhi, E.Johns and A.J. DavisonObjectivesLiterature Review: Select relevant approaches for PDL1 classification.Computer Vision Tasks:Perform classification at the slide level using weak annotations.Conduct patch-level classification or segmentation using full or semi-annotations.Model Explainability: Enhance the modelâ€™s interpretability to increase clinical usability.Product Development: Contribute to the clinical application of the proposed solution.Practical InformationsRemuneration: â‚¬1000/month + 50% Navigo refund.Location: Primaa is based in Paris, 2Ã¨me arrondissement, with the possibility of occasional remote work.

Descriptif du posteWho we areHelsing is a defence AI company. Our mission is to protect our democracies. We aim to achieve technological leadership, so that open societies can continue to make sovereign decisions and control their ethical standards.Â As democracies, we believe we have a special responsibility to be thoughtful about the development and deployment of powerful technologies like AI. We take this responsibility seriously.Â We are an ambitious and committed team of engineers, AI specialists and customer-facing programme managers.Â We are looking for mission-driven people to join our European teams â€“ and apply their skills to solve the most complex and impactful problems. We embrace an open and transparent culture that welcomes healthy debates on the use of technology in defence, its benefits, and its ethical implications.Â The roleÂ As a an intern, you will push the current understanding of how advances in the research community can add value to real-world applications.You will bridge fundamental and applied research with concrete implementations for real-world problems in the defence domain.You will propose and evaluate different methodologies to improve mission-critical systems.You will work as part of a team to deliver high-impact products.The day-to-dayResearch relevant papers in the areas of AI (in particular Generative AI, Computer Vision, and Computer Graphics).Conceptualise applications of state-of-the-art technologies and discuss them with the team.Understand advantages and disadvantages of different algorithmic approaches for our product.Derive requirements regarding software architectures and implement selected software designs.Summarise findings in clearly understandable documents.Contribute towards the implementation of the most promising concepts.You should apply if youCurrently pursuing a PhD or MSc in Generative AI, Computer Vision, or Computer Graphics.Proficient in Python.Experience in developing AI/ML algorithms with a focus on synthetic data generation.Experience with AI frameworks like PyTorch, NumPy, OpenCV.Experience with software and infrastructure frameworks like Git and Unix.Ability to communicate ideas clearly and work reliably and independently.Note: We operate at an intersection where women, as well as other minority groups, are systemically under-represented. We encourage you to apply even if you donâ€™t meet all the listed qualifications; ability and impact cannot be summarised in a few bullet points.Nice to havePublished a ML/AI paper at a top-tier conference or journal (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, ICLR, etc.).Experience in working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.Skills in developing quick prototypes to test and iterate on new ideas.Join Helsing and work with world-leading experts in their fieldsÂ Helsingâ€™s work is important. Youâ€™ll be directly contributing to the protection of democratic countries while balancing both ethical and geopolitical concerns.Â The work is unique. We operate in a domain that has highly unusual technical requirements and constraints, and where robustness, safety, and ethical considerations are vital. You will face unique Engineering and AI challenges that make a meaningful impact in the world.Â Our work frequently takes us right up to the state of the art in technical innovation, be it reinforcement learning, distributed systems, generative AI, or deployment infrastructure. The defence industry is entering the most exciting phase of the technological development curve. Advances in our field of world are not incremental: Helsing is part of, and often leading, historic leaps forward.Â In our domain, success is a matter of order-of-magnitude improvements and novel capabilities. This means we take bets, aim high, and focus on big opportunities. Despite being a relatively young company, Helsing has already been selected for multiple significant government contracts.Â Â We actively encourage healthy, proactive, and diverse debate internally about what we do and how we choose to do it. Teams and individual engineers are trusted (and encouraged) to practise responsible autonomy and critical thinking, and to focus on outcomes, not conformity. At Helsing you will have a say in how we (and you!) work, the opportunity to engage on what does and doesnâ€™t work, and to take ownership of aspects of our culture that you care deeply about.Â What we offerA focus on outcomes, not time-trackingSocial allowancesRegular company events and all-hands to bring together employees as one team across EuropeA hands-on onboarding program (affectionately labelled â€œAI-ductionâ€), in which you will be familiarising yourself with our tools and ML pipelines used across the company. This is your opportunity to learn our tech stack, explore the company, and learn how we get things done - all whilst working with other AI and engineering teams from day one

company_data.sector: Intelligence artificielle / Machine Learning, Pharmaceutique / Biotechnologique, SantÃ©

description: Descriptif du posteLeading AI Research Projects: Spearheading innovative AI-driven projects, from conception to execution, to advance our understanding of cancer biology and identify novel therapeutic targets.Developing Cutting-Edge AI Models: Designing, training, and optimizing state-of-the-art AI models to analyze complex biological and clinical data, predict patient outcomes, and identify potential drug candidates.Collaborating with Cross-Functional Teams: Working closely with biologists, clinicians, and data scientists to translate research findings into actionable insights and develop novel therapeutic strategies.Mentoring and Developing Talent: Guiding and mentoring junior researchers, fostering a collaborative and innovative research environment.Publishing Research Findings: Authoring high-impact publications in top-tier scientific journals and presenting research findings at international conferences.

Descriptif du posteAt Deepomatic, we are revolutionizing industries by harnessing the power of AI-driven image recognition. Our mission is to transform field operations and quality control, enabling companies to automate visual tasks at an unprecedented scale, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in real-time. We enable industries like telecommunications, utilities and green energy to increase their First Time Right Rate, with no more errors left behind. Our product offering includes an image recognition platform that allows users to train, deploy, and run high-performance AI models, a mobile experience that integrates these AIs with the tools used by engineers in the field, and back-office tools to leverage the data generated.As a Computer Vision Solution Architect, you will be a key technical leader, guiding projects from conception to completion. Internally, youâ€™ll collaborate closely with sales, product, customer success, and solution engineering teams. Thus, you will ensure our cutting-edge solutions are tailored to meet customer needs and delivered with precision. The role is highly cross-functional, at the crossroads of data science, product expertise and technical project management. A project usually involves the following main phases:Rapidly develop proof-of-concepts using Deepomaticâ€™s in-house modelsPrepare datasets, train neural networks, and evaluate performance metricsDesign and implement end-to-end workflows, ensuring maximized production performanceParticipate in project management initiatives, holding regular customer meetings to address progress and issuesDeploy solutions in the cloud, monitor system behaviour, and provide ongoing supportConduct on-site visits to assess customer needs and ensure technical feasibilityAt Deepomatic, we believe in empowering our team to lead with innovation and impact. As a Solution Architect, youâ€™ll not only shape groundbreaking AI solutions but also play a critical role in driving our customersâ€™ success and pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible with computer vision.Within 1 month, you will:Start mastering our platform, gaining hands-on experience with product components and internal toolsDive into real customer use cases to see how our cutting-edge solutions are transforming industriesComplete your onboarding project via our online academyWithin 3 months, you will:Design and deliver your first successful proof-of-concepts for prospective customersGrow confident in your knowledge of our productâ€™s key componentsCollaborate with cross-functional teams, gaining insights into the sales process and the technical execution of projects by shadowing solution engineers, solution architects and customer success managers during calls and meetingsWithin 6 months, you will:Participate in the implementation of an enterprise account, by scoping and delivering a high-impact pilot projectContribute to the development of internal tools or off-the-shelf models to improve productivity in the teamVisit customer sites to gain first-hand understanding of how solutions are used in the field

highly-performing credit scoring models tailored to maximize the risk reward.Â Leverage PSD2 (open banking) data and other alternative data to enhance predictive power and accuracy.Â Incorporate latest best practices and regulatory standards.Â Drive innovation in risk modelling techniques, utilizing machine learning and advanced analytics when relevant.Â Ensure continuous internal communication over projectsâ€™ roadmaps and best practices around the different uses of the score throughout the decision system.Â Model Deployment and Operational IntegrationÂ Ensure seamless integration of credit scores into Younitedâ€™s decision engines, enabling real-time risk-based decisioning.Â Deploy models on the platform in collaboration with ML Engineers, adhering to best credit scoring roadmap by evaluating the impact on origination quality and overall business objectives.Â Collaborate with Model Risk Management to ensure compliance with internal governance and regulatory requirements.

Descriptif du posteAs a Data Scientist at Mytraffic you will be part of a team called Predictive Analytics, responsible for answering business questions vital to our clients, based on data. Mytraffic relies on a large amount of spatial datasets to model urban behaviour, which can be used to make decisions such as: where are my competitors? Which is the best location for a new site? Which features are driving my sales? Is my point of sale under/over performing with respect to its potential?Our dataset streams come from both internal data (coming directly from our customers for their own use) and external data (retrieved, cleaned and prepared internally at Mytraffic from several sources), which are used to deliver analyses and insights allowing our customers to understand their current and past business situation (descriptive analytics), providing them with models and tools to be able to predict the impact and effects of potential business actions and decisions (predictive analytics) and, at a higher level, recommend them which of those actions and decisions should be taken to maximise their final revenue (prescriptive analytics).To do so we rely heavily on Python, and more precisely, on three different types of technology:Data management and analysis tools (e.g. Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn,Plotnine, Jupyterâ€¦), machine learning frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, LIMEâ€¦) Software development oriented libraries (e.g. Flask, Pytest..)What you can expect from the job:If you donâ€™t meet all the criteria, donâ€™t worry. At Mytraffic, we believe in continuous learning. If this role interests you, please apply and explain your motivations. Weâ€™d love to hear from you!At Mytraffic, we embrace evolution and changes, so you need to be prepared to evolve and change with the rest of the company.With that in mind, these are the sort of things you can expect to be doing:â— Design, develop, monitor and maintain a wide range of explanatory and predictive models and integrate them into the production environment so users can make predictions in real time.â— Analyze the most extensive and complete spatial database to understand a wide range of industries (retail, real-state, fmcg, e-mobility) consumerâ€™s behaviour patterns, etc.â— Load & Extract data from our datalakes and databases to support clients or build reports.â— Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the Customer Success team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyoneâ€™s needs and develop optimal solutions.

Is my point of sale under/over performing with respect to its potential?Our dataset streams come from both internal data (coming directly from our customers for their own use) and external data (retrieved, cleaned and prepared internally at Mytraffic from several sources), which are used to deliver analyses and insights allowing our customers to understand their current and past business situation (descriptive analytics), providing them with models and tools to be able to predict the impact and effects of potential business actions and decisions (predictive analytics) and, at a higher level, recommend them which of those actions and decisions should be taken to maximise their final revenue (prescriptive analytics).To do so we rely heavily on Python, and more precisely, on three different types of technology:Data management and analysis tools (e.g. Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn,Plotnine, Jupyterâ€¦), machine learning frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, LIMEâ€¦) Software development oriented libraries (e.g. Flask, Pytest..)What you can expect from the job:If you donâ€™t meet all the criteria, donâ€™t worry. At Mytraffic, we believe in continuous learning. If this role interests you, please apply and explain your motivations. Weâ€™d love to hear from you!At Mytraffic, we embrace evolution and changes, so you need to be prepared to evolve and change with the rest of the company.With that in mind, these are the sort of things you can expect to be doing:â— Design, develop, monitor and maintain a wide range of explanatory and predictive models and integrate them into the production environment so users can make predictions in real time.â— Analyze the most extensive and complete spatial database to understand a wide range of industries (retail, real-state, fmcg, e-mobility) consumerâ€™s behaviour patterns, etc.â— Load & Extract data from our datalakes and databases to support clients or build reports.â— Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the Customer Success team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyoneâ€™s needs and develop optimal solutions.

job_title: PhD Position - Graph Neural Networks for Registration of 3D Multi-Modal Images

company_data.sector: Logiciels, Intelligence artificielle / Machine Learning, Pharmaceutique / Biotechnologique, SantÃ©

description: Descriptif du posteThe accurate registration of 3D multi-modal medical images taken in different patient positions, such as supine and upright, is crucial for numerous clinical applications, including diagnosis, treatment planning, and monitoring disease progression. However, position changes and tissue deformations pose significant challenges to image registration, as they can cause substantial discrepancies between scans. These discrepancies can obscure critical in treatment implementation and impede the precise alignment necessary for effective clinical interventions.This thesis aims to develop an innovative end-to-end framework leveraging deep learning to achieve precise registration between 3D multi-modal images taken at supine and upright positions. The primary objective is to develop a robust model that can recover bone structures and articulate models to align images accurately, accounting for positional changes and couple them with a dense deformation model to deal with tissue/anatomical changes due gravity. This model will be designed to automatically adjust for anatomical variations and the complex, non-rigid deformations that occur when a patient shifts from one position to another. Prostate cancer treatment delivery where registration between supine MR scans and Upright CT scans in the context of radiotherapy with a prospective clinical trial/evaluation will be used to demonstrate the clinical relevance of the developed technology.
